qas.question: What year did the Roman Republic use for dates?
What event started the consular year?
What was the date of the consular year before 222 BC?
What was the date of the start of the consular year from 222 BC?
When did Rome begin to use the Julian calendar?
What was used as the year in the early Roman church?
What calendar came into use in 153 BC?
During what period did a year used for dates not change?
What was marked by the date the Emperor took office?

context: <b8_0>The year<b8_0/> used in dates during the Roman Republic and the Roman Empire was the <a0_0><b5_0>consular year<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which began on the day when <a1_0>consuls first entered office<a1_0/>—probably <a2_0>1 May<a2_0/> before 222 BC, <a3_0>15 March<a3_0/> from 222 BC and 1 January from 153 BC. The <b6_0>Julian calendar,<b6_0/> which began in <a4_0>45 BC<a4_0/>, continued to use 1 January as the first day of the new year. Even though the year used for dates changed, the civil year always displayed its months in the order January to December from the <b7_0>Roman Republican period<b7_0/> until the present.
